website_summaries.verdict: Simple, compact dirt bike ramp that will support bikes up to 750 pounds, all at a great price point.
pros: Folds down to 45 by 5.5 inches for easy storage
Uses serrated rungs that give a bit of traction for the bike's wheels during loading so they won't slip
Has rubber-coated ends to protect the truck during loading
Ramp weighs just 17 pounds, so it's easy to move around
cons: May struggle to support larger bikes
Would be nice if it was just a little wider

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but super strong.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to load my Yamaha V-Star Classic in the back of my truck. The plastic tips grip well so it doesn't slip off during loading. Folds in half for transport or storage. The hinge holds well and doesn't have any play in it or flaws. I was worried that a folding ramp might snap under the weight of the hundreds of pounds my bike is. Was perfect. Would recommend for dirtbikes and even heavier ones like cruisers. May need one that holds more weight if you have something like a Street glide or Road King. Check the weight before attempting. The packaging was wrapped well and not sloppy. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Ensign

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: It's tough unloading a motorcycle by yourself from a full size pickup with this ramp because of the steep slope. If you have a hill or wall then it's no problem. If you have a friend to help then it's also not bad. It's lightweight and very easy to set up and use. Very sturdy and I'm glad I spent a few extra bucks to get this one. The bike I use it for is a suzuki dr650.
customer_reviews.author: G.C.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice ramp for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as a just because gift. He's been racing dirt bikes for years and also used a notched out 2 x 4 to push it in the trailer. I think he was shocked when he opened this. He has a 450 and uses it for every race now. It very light weight and folds up in half. He put hooks in his trailer and secured it on the inside wall. Very nice ramp for the price. Lets see how it holds up with the new 2016 CRF450R. If it ever gets released that is!
customer_reviews.author: Ronda  Frank

customer_reviews.title: Super strong perfect for motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this ramp for months. Has never let me down and is super sturdy. Glad they include straps just shows how great they are.
customer_reviews.author: Family perspective

customer_reviews.title: For the money, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.text: This was the cheapest option that I saw when looking here on Amazon. Based on the reviews I figured I would give it a try. My bike is only a 125 and is extremely easy to load with this ramp. I also loaded my friend's YZ-250 and had no trouble. For the money this is the way to go based on what I have seen.
customer_reviews.author: FMP

customer_reviews.title: Buy 2
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly strong, nice and light, and well designed. Do yourself a favor and buy 2 or three, so handoffs at the top of the ramp aren't a total PITA, and/or you can likely rid any dirtbike out there up with room for your feet on the sides...
customer_reviews.author: Uriel

customer_reviews.title: Check the nuts and bolts!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize the bolts were loose...I lost one and the other one I was only able to find the bolt without the nut. You cannot order replacements so my local hardware store did the best they could. It works fine now, just make sure you check them before heading out and actually use the item.
customer_reviews.author: g0tr00t

customer_reviews.title: Does what you need
customer_reviews.text: My Bed rug doesn't let it slip, so I haven't bothered with the tie down it comes with it, but if I need one, I'd use on the good ones I already have. The RAMP it what you're buying, and it is all it needs to be.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Well built motorcycle ramps.
customer_reviews.text: Well built and worked just fine with my GSXR 1000.
customer_reviews.author: A. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Solid, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Using this to bring my Sym Fiddle III motorscooter into the house when I work on it, going up a 24 inch rise of steps, very solid and easy to use. Front 'forks' of the ramp fit well on stairs and no bump coming off of ramp.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Worked great '05 V Strom 1000
customer_reviews.text: Bought this ramp to transport my '05 DL1000 V Strom. Worked great getting it in and out of my truck. Sturdy but flexible construction. Comes with strap to attach ramp to hitch for extra security, but the strap is of questionable quality. Rubber coated arms to prevent damage to truck. Overall very satisfied. Would rate 5/5 if strap worked better.
customer_reviews.author: Nico P

customer_reviews.title: Great ramp for the price
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Loaded my 550 pound motorcycle up no problems. The link to the truck to avoid it flying off is great too.
customer_reviews.author: Bocephus

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great quality. Zero complaints. Folds so it's easy to store
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good so far
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my yamaha 250 and flexes a little. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Braddah

customer_reviews.title: Great little ramp
customer_reviews.text: Great little ramp! Wife got it for me for christmas, way easier (and safer) than trying to lift the bike to to the bed of the truck. Used it about 20x this summer, worked great and is holding up excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Kerr

customer_reviews.title: made really strong
customer_reviews.text: make getting bikes and scooters and motorcycles up in truck so easy. found better price elsewhere but with shipping and they don't have two day delivery.
customer_reviews.author: groovy girl

customer_reviews.title: Great and light weight
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome ramp. It has a cinch down strap that you can connect to your hitch or bumper so the ramp does not move. The ramp has really good grip as well.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Need confidence with it
customer_reviews.text: Nice price, light, well constructed, but I do not have confidence in it with anything more than 175-200 lbs because the hinge creaks and I hope the welds stay together. I would buy again but prefer half a wheel chair ramp instead.
customer_reviews.author: E  Wisdom

customer_reviews.title: AWESOMENESS!
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what I wanted and needed for my 3 dirt bikes. Even comes with a tie-down so the ladder doesn't fall while your loading it.
customer_reviews.author: Shereneaun

customer_reviews.title: 89" Arched Folding Ramp
customer_reviews.text: Ramp works just fine. One of the prongs that sit on the tailgate is a little bent but not a big deal. Use this for walking my bike up into my truck. I use a bigger more sturdier ramp for my bike though.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Ayala

customer_reviews.title: Greta ramp for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, no downsides that I can find yet. It says tested to 750lbs, so I should be able to ride my bike up it but I don't have great confidence it would hold both of us
customer_reviews.author: Courtney P.

customer_reviews.title: I love this ramp!
customer_reviews.text: I love this ramp! I've been using it for a while and is the perfect size and angle for my Dakota. I have no problem loading my sportbike and my dirtbike by myself. I have recommended this ramp to many people
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Brother in law loves it cause he is short and cannot ramp his motorcycle well without it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J Stumpff

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Got for my brother he loves them! Light weight and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective, durable
customer_reviews.text: Does its job perfectly. Been using it for 3 seasons, never had an issue. Good build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rabih M. El-Khoury

customer_reviews.title: good deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: Item was as described. Functions well, good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Very light and study. Really like the safety strap. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's going to work just great, and for a hundred dollars less then at ...
customer_reviews.text: It's going to work just great,and for a hundred dollars less then at dealership.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Nice ramp
customer_reviews.text: Works good light weight, folds in half over all happy.
customer_reviews.author: King

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works really well to load a yamaha R6 into trailer.
customer_reviews.author: RMcKee

customer_reviews.title: It does exactly what it should
customer_reviews.text: I transported my 1979 Kawasaki kz650 from my garage via a Toyota Tacoma pickup truck and used this ramp. Dry weight of bike: 450 lbs - according to manufacturer. plus 3 gallons of gas in the tank. The ramp folds up and is quite sturdy. It DOES flex very slightly as bike runs along it. This is part of the design - controlled flex alleviates stress. I will use this for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: hiscifi

customer_reviews.title: works excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product at an excellent price, made by an excellent Wisconsin company. What is not to like? lol No, I don't work there, it just works great.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Works good - used it on a 400 lb bike without trouble
customer_reviews.text: My main reservation about this ramp is that it's nearly impossible to use by yourself because you have nowhere to walk beside the bike. I ended up trading it for one that is wider and it gives you a lot more confidence that you're not going to end up with a motorcycle on top of you because you lost your footing trying to climb up onto the tailgate.
customer_reviews.author: Ethosian

customer_reviews.title: Great MC loading ramp
customer_reviews.text: I bought a similar ramp about 6-7 years ago for around $180.00 This one is 95% as good for less than $80.00!! Loaded my 2006 Suzuki GSXR 1000 into my GMC Safari van with no problems. (bike weighs around 500 pounds wet, so I would say it is a good sportbike ramp, not just "dirtbike" ramp...) I would buy this ramp again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: erikt

product_meta.title: Black Widow AFL-9012 Single Runner Motorcycle Ramp – Finger-Style Lip, Rung Surface
product_meta.description:
Manufactured from high-strength, lightweight aluminum, this folding bike ramp has a 750 lb. weight capacity and is the ultimate combination of strength and convenience. Arched for maximum clearance, this ramp features hinge system that allows the ramp to be folded in half for compact storage and transportability. Heavy-duty serrated cross bars provide excellent traction in any weather condition, and the tapered bottom edge making the loading process as safe and smooth as possible. This ramp is held in place by a set of rubber-coated fingers that grip the tailgate without scratching and an included adjustable safety strap.

We recommend always working with at least two people when using single-runner ramps for loading. These aluminum motocross ramps are not intended for riding your bike up because they are not wide enough to put your feet down when loading and unloading.
feature_bullets: Folding single-runner ramp for loading and unloading motorcycles, dirt bikes, and more
Serrated rungs for superior traction with an arched design for maximum engine and tailpipe clearance
Rubber-coated finger-style attaching points support ramp on vehicle without scratching paint
Manufactured from lightweight aluminum with a 750 lb. weight capacity
Measures 7' 5-1/4" L x 11-1/8" W and folds in half for easy transport and storage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars90 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
